definition: surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: He also insinuates that the oral tradition from which the Gospels originated was flawed.
sentences.chinese: 他还暗示，福音书因为口口相传是有缺陷的。

sentences.english: The Gospel is clear on that, too. Woe to you on whom the evil demons act.
sentences.chinese: 福音书上很清楚，对那些被魔鬼附身的表述悲哀吧。

sentences.english: you learned about the synoptic problem last week.
sentences.chinese: 上一周你们都知道了对观福音书问题。

sentences.english: In the gospels Jesus predicts the end of the world and the coming of the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 在福音书中，耶稣预言世界的末了，以及神国的降临。

sentences.english: The Gospel was one of three texts bound together in a codex, or ancient book.
sentences.chinese: 这本福音书是三份装订在一起的古书中的一份。

sentences.english: A nurse’s fairy-tales are accepted as the gospel truth.
sentences.chinese: 保姆的神话故事被当作福音书中的真理而接受。

sentences.english: I’m sure that he did, but the gospels never mention it.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他笑过，但福音书从来没有提到过。

sentences.english: One of the Gospels says they sang a hymn and they went out.
sentences.chinese: 福音书之一讲述他们唱着圣歌离开的场景。

sentences.english: The first three Evangelists spoke of redemption as a pardon of sin, or Justification.
sentences.chinese: 在前三本福音书中，说到救赎乃是罪得赦免或称义。

sentences.english: It is commonly understood that Luke's Gospel was intended first for Gentiles.
sentences.chinese: 所以，普遍认为路加的福音书最初打算为外邦人而写。

sentences.english: Another area of controversy focuses on apparent contradictions among the Gospels.
sentences.chinese: 争论的另一个焦点在于福音书里明显的自我矛盾之处。

sentences.english: It leads to propounding "the absurdity of the Gospel."
sentences.chinese: 这一方向会导致“福音书的荒谬性”的问题。

sentences.english: Christ's reply is composed of some of the greatest words of the Gospel.
sentences.chinese: 基督的回答包含了福音书中一段最重要的谈话。

sentences.english: One of the Twelve Apostles, traditional author of the first Gospel.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣十二使徒之一，相传为第一部福音书的作者。

sentences.english: The names in the Gospels were added by later scribes.
sentences.chinese: 福音书的名字是后来文士加上去的。

sentences.english: Yale passed on purchasing the Gospel because of such concerns.
sentences.chinese: 出于这样的担心，耶鲁没有买下这份福音书。

definition: the Pentateuch/the five books of Moses in the Old Testament
synoptic gospels (i.e. Matthew, Mark and Luke, with similar accounts and chronology)
Book of Job (in the Old Testament)
